2026-01-03:
上善若水。水善利萬物而不爭，處眾人之所惡，故幾於道。
The highest goodness is like water:
Water benefits all things and does not contend.
It dwells in places others avoid.
Thus it is close to the Dao.
2026-01-04: The Dao does not hurry, yet nothing is left undone. 道不急行，而无不成。
2026-01-05: When you stop forcing, life begins flowing. 不强求，顺其自然。
2026-01-06: Softness overcomes hardness; stillness overcomes movement. 柔胜刚，静胜躁。
2026-01-07: The river does not argue with the rock—it simply flows around it. 水不争石，绕之而行。
2026-01-08: To know others is wisdom; to know yourself is enlightenment. 知人者智，自知者明。
2026-01-09: Empty your cup, and the Dao can fill it. 虚其心，道自满。
2026-01-10: The sage acts without striving and teaches without words. 圣人无为而教，无言而化。
2026-01-11: Nature never explains itself, yet everything unfolds perfectly. 天地不言，而万物自成。
2026-01-12: A mind too full cannot receive truth. 心满则不容道。
2026-01-13: Do less, and gain more. 少为多得。
2026-01-14: He who is content is rich. 知足者富。
2026-01-15: What is rigid breaks; what is flexible endures. 刚则折，柔则存。
2026-01-16: In stillness, the answer appears. 静中自见。
2026-01-17: Let go of what you are holding, and you will be free. 放下执念，自得自在。
2026-01-18: The Dao is found in the ordinary. 道在寻常处。
2026-01-19: To yield is to be preserved. 让则全。
2026-01-20: Those who speak do not know; those who know do not speak. 知者不言，言者不知。
2026-01-21: A journey of a thousand miles begins beneath your feet. 千里之行，始于足下。
2026-01-22: When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you. 知无缺，天下皆归。
2026-01-23: The Dao is like a well: used but never used up. 道如井，用之不竭。
2026-01-24: Hold to the center. 守中。
2026-01-25: Be like water: adapt, nourish, and do not compete. 如水：随形，利物，不争。
2026-01-26: Greatness comes from humility. 大者以卑成。
2026-01-27: When you are at peace, you are aligned with the Dao. 心安则道在。
2026-01-28: The more you chase, the less you have. 逐越多，得越少。
2026-01-29: Return to simplicity. 复归于朴。
2026-01-30: Trust the unfolding. 信其自化。
2026-01-31: Do not seek to control—seek to understand. 不求控，只求明。
2026-02-01: Silence is often the clearest teaching. 无声之教最明。
